citations.narrative:
The licensee voluntarily indicated that he did not have disposition records for the inspector to review for 2 dogs sold since
the last inspection. All sales of dogs and puppies must be maintained and available for an APHIS inspector review
Records containing the required information for animals disposed of, are necessary to accurately track animals and to
ensure their humane care and use. The licensee must make and maintain records of disposition of all animals to fully and
correctly disclose the required information in this subpart 2.75(b)(1). Correct by August 18, 2025

The contingency plan was not available for review and the licensee did not perform the annual review. The plan must be
reviewed by the dealer on at least an annual basis to ensure that it adequately addresses the criteria listed in 2.134(a).
Each licensee and registrant must maintain documentation of their annual reviews, including documenting any
amendments or changes made to their plan since the previous year's review. Contingency plans, as well as all annual
review documentation, must be made available to APHIS upon request. Correct by August 18, 2025
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
n

narrative:
2.75(a)(1) 
   
Records: Dealers and exhibitors. 
The licensee voluntarily indicated that he did not have disposition records for the inspector to review for 2 dogs sold since 
the last inspection. All sales of dogs and puppies must be maintained and available for an APHIS inspector review 
Records containing the required information for animals disposed of, are necessary to accurately track animals and to 
ensure their humane care and use. The licensee must make and maintain records of disposition of all animals to fully and 
correctly disclose the required information in this subpart 2.75(b)(1). Correct by August 18, 2025 
2.134(b) 
   
Contingency planning. 
The contingency plan was not available for review and the licensee did not perform the annual review. The plan must be 
reviewed by the dealer on at least an annual basis to ensure that it adequately addresses the criteria listed in 2.134(a). 
Each licensee and registrant must maintain documentation of their annual reviews, including documenting any 
amendments or changes made to their plan since the previous year's review. Contingency plans, as well as all annual 
review documentation, must be made available to APHIS upon request. Correct by August 18, 2025 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
